fields.name: simulation_type
fields.label: Simulation Type
fields.toolTip: Define the type of simulation.
whatsThis: - FullCascade: Simulate full damage cascades, follow recoils
- IonsOnly: Simulate only ions, do not follow recoils
- CascadesOnly: Simulate recoil cascades

fields.name: screening_type
fields.label: Screening Type
fields.toolTip: Define the type of screening potential.
whatsThis: - None: Unscreened Coulomb potential
- Bohr: Bohr screening
- KrC: Kr-C screening
- Moliere - Moliere screening
- ZBL - Ziegler-Biersack-Littmark universal screening
- ZBL_MAGIC - ZBL with analytic approx. formula
For Unscreened Coulomb and ZBL_MAGIK the scattering is calculated analytically.
In all other cases interpolation tables are used.

fields.name: electronic_stopping
fields.label: Electronic Stopping
fields.toolTip: Calculation of electronic stopping.
whatsThis: - Off: No electronic stopping
- SRIM96: Using the SRIM parametrization, v. 1996
- SRIM13: Using the SRIM parametrization, v. 2013
- DPASS22: Using the DPASS parametrization, v. 21.06

fields.name: electronic_straggling
fields.label: Electronic Straggling
fields.toolTip: Calculation of electronic straggling.
whatsThis: - Off: No electronic straggling.
- Bohr: According to the Bohr model
- Chu: According to the model of Chu et al.
- Yang: According to the model of Yang et al.

fields.name: nrt_calculation
fields.label: NRT calculation
fields.toolTip: Define how to implement NRT in multielemental targets.
whatsThis: - NRT_element: NRT calculated per recoil atom
- NRT_average: NRT calculated using material average values

fields.name: intra_cascade_recombination
fields.label: Intra-cascade recombination
fields.toolTip: Enable intra-cascade recombination of Frenkel pairs.

fields.name: min_energy
fields.label: Energy cutoff (eV)
fields.toolTip: Lowest kinetic energy of a simulated ion.
whatsThis: When the energy of an ion goes below this cutoff,
the ion history is terminated.

fields.name: flight_path_type
fields.label: Flight Path Type
fields.toolTip: Flight path sampling algorithm.
whatsThis: - Constant: User defined constant flight path
- Variable: Sampled flight path, energy dependent mean free path

fields.name: flight_path_const
fields.label: Const. Flight Path [units of atomic radius]
fields.toolTip: Constant Flight Path in units of the atomic radius.
whatsThis: Used when flight_path_type=Constant

fields.name: max_rel_eloss
fields.label: Max (ΔE/E)e
fields.toolTip: Maximum allowed relative energy loss per flight path.
whatsThis: Applicable only when flight_path_type=Variable

fields.name: min_recoil_energy
fields.label: Min recoil E (eV)
fields.toolTip: Minimum recoil energy in eV.
whatsThis: Events with recoil energy below this value will be ignoredif the scattering angle is also below min_scattering_angle.
Applicable only when flight_path_type=Variable

fields.name: min_scattering_angle
fields.label: Min θ (º)
fields.toolTip: Minimum scattering angle in degrees.
whatsThis: Refers to the projectile scattering angle in the lab reference frame.
Events with scattering angle lower that this value will be ignotred if the recoil energy is also below min_recoil_energy.
Applicable only when flight_path_type=Variable

fields.name: mfp_range
fields.label: Range of ion mfp [units of Rat]
fields.toolTip: Range of ion mean free path in units of atomic radius.
whatsThis: Applicable only when flight_path_type=Variable

fields.name: symbol
fields.label: Symbol
fields.toolTip: Chemical element symbol.

fields.name: atomic_number
fields.label: Atomic number
fields.toolTip: Atomic number of the generated ions.

fields.name: atomic_mass
fields.label: Atomic mass
fields.toolTip: Atomic mass of the generated ions.

fields.name: type
fields.label: Distribution type
fields.toolTip: Type of energy distribution of the generated ions.
whatsThis: - Single Value: All ions have the same energy
- Uniform: Ion energy distributed uniformly within center ± fwhm/2
- Gaussian: Ion energy distributed according to the Gaussian(Normal) distribution around the center value with given fwhm
When sampling from a distribution, out-of-bounds values are rejected and a new sample is drawn.

fields.name: center
fields.label: Central energy (eV)
fields.toolTip: Central energy of generated ions in eV.

fields.name: fwhm
fields.label: FWHM (eV)
fields.toolTip: Full-width at half-maximum of the generated ions energy distribution in eV.

fields.name: geometry
fields.label: Source geometry
fields.toolTip: Geometry of the ion source.
whatsThis: - Surface: Ions are generated on a simulation boundary surface.
- Volume: Ions are generated within the simulation volume.

fields.name: type
fields.label: Distribution type
fields.toolTip: Type of spatial distribution of the generated ions.
whatsThis: - Single Value: All ions have the same initial position
- Uniform: Ion position distributed uniformly around the center position
- Gaussian: Ion position distributed according to the Gaussian(Normal) distribution around the center position with given fwhm
Surface(2D) distributions are sampled on the left yz-plane bounding the simulation box.
In a Uniform surface(volume) distribution, the position is sampled uniformly in a square(cube) of width fwhm around the center.
In a Gaussian distribution, each component of the position vector is sampled from a Gaussian with the same fwhm around the center.
When sampling from a distribution, out-of-bounds positions are rejected and a new sample is drawn.

fields.name: center
fields.label: Center position (nm)
fields.toolTip: Central initial position of generated ions, [x,y,z] in nm.
fields.whatsThis: Must be either within the simulation box or at the lowest yz-plane boundary.

fields.name: fwhm
fields.label: FWHM (nm)
fields.toolTip: Full-width at half-maximum of the generated ions position distribution in nm.

fields.name: type
fields.label: Distribution type
fields.toolTip: Type of angular distribution of the generated ions.
whatsThis: - Single Value: All ions have the same initial direction
- Uniform: Ion direction distributed uniformly within a cone around the central direction
- Gaussian: Ion direction distributed according to the Gaussian(Normal) distribution around the central direction

fields.name: center
fields.label: Center direction
fields.toolTip: Ion beam central direction vector, [nx,ny,nz], unnormalized.

fields.name: fwhm
fields.label: FWHM (srad)
fields.toolTip: Width in srad of a cone around the central ion beam direction.
whatsThis: For the Uniform distribution, fwhm defines a cone around the main direction, where the direction of generated ions is sampled uniformly
The Gaussian distrubution is not yet implemented

fields.name: size

fields.name: cell_count

fields.toolTip: Number of simulation cells along the x-, y- and z-axis.

fields.name: periodic_bc

fields.toolTip: Displacement energy [eV].
fields.whatsThis: Energy required to displace an atom from its atomic position.

fields.name: El

fields.name: Rc

fields.toolTip: Recombination radius [nm].
fields.whatsThis: A Frenkel pair with an I-V distance R<Rc recombines spontaneously.

fields.name: id
fields.label: region id
fields.toolTip: Name of the region.

fields.name: material_id
fields.label: Material id
fields.toolTip: Id of the material that fills the region.

fields.name: origin
fields.label: Origin [x₀,y₀,z₀] (nm)
fields.toolTip: Origin of the region.

fields.name: size
fields.label: Size [Lx, Ly, Lz] (nm)
fields.toolTip: Size in nm of the simulation volume along the x-, y- and z-axis.

fields.name: title
fields.label: Title
fields.toolTip: Short title describing the simulation.

fields.label: Output file name
fields.toolTip: Name of the output file without the extention.
whatsThis: The extention '.h5' will be added.
The name can contain the relative or absolute path to the file.

fields.name: storage_interval

fields.name: store_pka_events

fields.name: store_damage_events

fields.toolTip: Store a table of damage events.

fields.name: store_dedx

fields.toolTip: Store electronic stopping tables for each ion/material combination.

fields.name: max_no_ions
fields.label: Max # of ions to simulate
fields.toolTip: Maximum number of ion histories to simulate.
fields.whatsThis: The simulation will stop when the maximum number of histories has been reached.

fields.name: threads
fields.label: Number of threads
fields.toolTip: Number of execution threads.

fields.name: seed
fields.label: Random number seed
fields.toolTip: Random number generator seed.

fields.name: id
fields.label: User specified tally id
fields.toolTip: User specified tally id (name).
whatsThis: For identifying the specific UserTally
in the output file etc.

fields.name: description
fields.label: User specified tally description
fields.toolTip: Short description of the tally.
whatsThis: One can give here a short explanation of
the purpose of setting up this tally,
what kind of information is expected, etc.

fields.name: event
fields.label: Type of simulation event to tally.
fields.toolTip: Simulation event that will trigger a tally score.
whatsThis: The supported events are:
- IonExit: the ion exits the simulation volume
- IonStop: the ion stops inside the simulation volume
- Vacancy: a lattice vacancy is created
- Replacement: a replacement event occurs
- CascadeComplete: a PKA cascade is completed
- BoundaryCrossing: an ion crosses an internal cell boundary

fields.name: origin
fields.label: Origin [x₀,y₀,z₀] (nm)
fields.toolTip: Origin of the UserTally coordinates.
fields.whatsThis: The vector is defined with respect to the simulation space.

fields.name: zaxis
fields.label: Z-axis direction vector
fields.toolTip: A vector parallel to the z-axis of the UserTally coordinate system.
fields.whatsThis: The vector is defined with respect to the simulation space.

fields.name: xzvector
fields.label: Vector on the xz-plane
fields.toolTip: A vector on the xz-plane of the UserTally coordinate system.
fields.whatsThis: The vector is defined with respect to the simulation space.

fields.name: x
fields.label: x-coordinate bin edges [nm]
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion position x-coordinate.
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: y
fields.label: y-coordinate bin edges [nm]
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion position y-coordinate.
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: z
fields.label: z-coordinate bin edges [nm]
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion position z-coordinate.
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: r
fields.label: Radial distance r [nm]
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's r=sqrt(x^2+y^2+z^2).
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: rho
fields.label: Cylindrical radial distance ρ [nm]
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's ρ=sqrt(x^2+y^2).
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: cosTheta
fields.label: Polar angle cosine cosθ
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's position cosθ = z/r.
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: nx
fields.label: x-axis direction cosine
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's x-axis direction cosine.
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: ny
fields.label: y-axis direction cosine
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's y-axis direction cosine.
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: nz
fields.label: z-axis direction cosine
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's z-axis direction cosine.
whatsThis: Coordinates refer to the UserTally coordinate system.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: E
fields.label: Ion kinetic energy [eV]
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's kinetic energy.
whatsThis: Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: Tdam
fields.label: Ion damage energy [eV]
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's damage energy.
whatsThis: Tdam refers to the energy of the PKA dissipated to atomic displacements during the whole cascade
This can be used only with events of type CascadeComplete
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: V
fields.label: Number of generated vacancies
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the number of generated vacancies.
whatsThis: It refers to the total number of vacancies generated in a PKA cascade
This can be used only with events of type CascadeComplete
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: atom_id
fields.label: Atomic species id
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's atomic species id.
whatsThis: Each atomic species in the simulation is assigned an id number
Beam ions always have an id of 0.
Target atoms recoils have id>=1.
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.

fields.name: recoil_id
fields.label: Recoil generation id
fields.toolTip: Bin edges for the ion's recoil generation id.
whatsThis: Beam ions always have a recoil generation id of 0.
PKAs have id=1. Higher order recoils have higher recoil ids
Bin edges must be monotonously increasing.
